hadiths.english_translation: Narrated through the chain: Gabriel (peace be upon him) came to the Prophet ﷺ and said: O Muhammad, be one who raises much dust and makes much volume with the talbiyah (pilgrimage call).

narrators.name: Ya'qub ibn Humayd
narrators.full_name: Ya'qub ibn Humayd al-Razi

narrators.name: Abu Tumayla Yahya ibn Wadih
narrators.full_name: Abu Tumayla Yahya ibn Wadih al-Kufi

narrators.name: Muhammad ibn Ishaq
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Ishaq ibn Yasar al-Madani

narrators.name: Abdullah ibn Abi Labid
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abi Labid al-Ansari

narrators.name: Al-Muttalib ibn Abdullah ibn Hantab
narrators.full_name: Al-Muttalib ibn Abdullah ibn Hantab al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Ibrahim ibn Khalad ibn Suwayd
narrators.full_name: Ibrahim ibn Khalad ibn Suwayd al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Khalad ibn Suwayd
narrators.full_name: Khalad ibn Suwayd al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: First narrator Ya'qub ibn Humayd is classified as da'if, critically weakening the chain
Transmission shifts from direct terms (نا) to indirect term (عَنْ) from Abdullah ibn Abi Labid
Multiple majhul narrators in the latter part of the chain

potential_issues.issue: Ya'qub ibn Humayd is da'if (weak) as primary narrator
potential_issues.impact: This is the critical issue that makes the entire hadith weak, as the first link in the chain is unreliable

potential_issues.issue: Muhammad ibn Ishaq is a mudallis using direct terms (نا) which is acceptable in this case
potential_issues.impact: However, his tendency to practice tadlis in other narrations should be noted

potential_issues.issue: Multiple majhul narrators (Abdullah ibn Abi Labid, Al-Muttalib, Ibrahim ibn Khalad, Khalad ibn Suwayd) using indirect transmission
potential_issues.impact: The presence of multiple unknown narrators in succession severely compromises the chain reliability

hadiths.IISGrade: Problematic
Topics: Command of Gabriel to the Prophet ﷺ
Dialogue between Gabriel and the Prophet ﷺ

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: This entry appears to be a fragmentary notation of a narrator rather than a complete hadith
No actual transmission chain or narration text provided, only naming of a narrator
Unclear how this connects to the preceding or following hadiths

potential_issues.issue: Incomplete entry with no transmission chain
potential_issues.impact: This appears to be a variant naming or supplementary narrator information rather than a complete hadith transmission

potential_issues.issue: No transmission terms or methodology provided
potential_issues.impact: Cannot assess the nature of transmission without the actual chain details

hadiths.IISGrade: Disconnections But All Narrators Are Ok

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Habah al-Ansari and Ibn Abbas: During the night of Isra (Night Journey), the Prophet ﷺ said: Then I was ascended with until I reached a place where I heard the sound of the pens (the pens of the angels writing down divine decree).

narrators.name: Ya'qub ibn Humayd
narrators.full_name: Ya'qub ibn Humayd al-Razi

narrators.name: Anas ibn Iyad
narrators.full_name: Anas ibn Iyad al-Bajali

narrators.name: Yunus
narrators.full_name: Yunus ibn Habibi al-Kilabi

narrators.name: Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Muslim ibn Ubaydullah al-Zuhri

narrators.name: Ibn Hazm
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Muhammad ibn Ali ibn Abd al-Aziz al-Makki
narrators.alternative_names: Ali ibn Muhammad al-Makki, Ali ibn Hazm

narrators.name: Abu Habah al-Ansari
narrators.full_name: Abu Habah ibn Amr ibn Thabit al-Ansari al-Badri

narrators.name: Ibn Abbas
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim al-Qurashi

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Ya'qub ibn Humayd is da'if, weakening the chain from the first narrator
Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri uses 'an without explicit confirmation of hearing, though he is generally reliable
Use of أَنَّ (anna) with Abu Habah and Ibn Abbas suggests indirect connection, though both are companions
The companions Abu Habah and Ibn Abbas are reported through أَنَّ which can indicate mursal or unclear transmission

potential_issues.issue: Ya'qub ibn Humayd as first narrator is da'if
potential_issues.impact: The weakness of the primary narrator significantly compromises the entire chain

potential_issues.issue: Ibn Shihab al-Zuhri, while generally thiqah, is a mudallis (category 2) using 'an
potential_issues.impact: Although he is reliable despite his tadlis, his use of 'an should be noted in the analysis

potential_issues.issue: Use of أَنَّ (anna) with companions Abu Habah and Ibn Abbas
potential_issues.impact: This transmission term suggests potential weakness in the connection, though the companions themselves are reliable

hadiths.IISGrade: Problematic
Topics: The Sound of Angels' Pens in the Heavens
Incident of Prophet Muhammad ﷺ ascending to heaven

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Habah al-Badri: When the verse was revealed: 'Those who disbelieve from the People of the Book', Gabriel (peace be upon him) said to the Messenger of Allah ﷺ: Verily your Lord commands you to teach Ubay this chapter. So the Messenger of Allah ﷺ said to Ubay: Verily Gabriel commanded me to teach you this chapter. Ubay said: Did Allah mention me by name? The Messenger of Allah ﷺ said: Yes.

narrators.name: Abu Bakr ibn Abi Shaybah
narrators.full_name: Abdullah ibn Muhammad ibn Uthman ibn Abi Shaybah al-Kufi
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Bakr al-Kufi, Ibn Abi Shaybah

narrators.name: Affan
narrators.full_name: Affan ibn Muslim al-Basri

narrators.name: Hammad ibn Salamah
narrators.full_name: Hammad ibn Salamah ibn Dinar al-Basri

narrators.name: Ali ibn Zayd
narrators.full_name: Ali ibn Zayd ibn Jud'an al-Basri
narrators.alternative_names: Ali ibn Zayd al-Basri, Abu Hatim

narrators.name: Ammar ibn Abi Ammar
narrators.full_name: Ammar ibn Abi Ammar al-Mawla al-Makki

narrators.name: Abu Habah al-Badri
narrators.full_name: Abu Habah ibn Amr ibn Thabit al-Ansari al-Badri
narrators.alternative_names: Abu Habah al-Ansari, Abu Habah al-Badri

narrators.name: Prophet Muhammad ﷺ
narrators.full_name: Muhammad ibn Abdullah ibn Abd al-Muttalib ibn Hashim

chainIssues: Overall good chain structure with thiqah narrators in the beginning
Ali ibn Zayd is saduq yahim (prone to errors) but still generally acceptable
Two indirect transmissions (عَنْ) through Ali ibn Zayd and Ammar ibn Abi Ammar
Abu Habah uses سَمِعَ (direct hearing) which is the strongest transmission term

potential_issues.issue: Ali ibn Zayd is rated as saduq yahim (makes errors)
potential_issues.impact: While still generally acceptable, Ali ibn Zayd's tendency to make mistakes should be noted, though his reliability is not critically compromised

potential_issues.issue: Two consecutive عَنْ transmissions from Ali ibn Zayd and Ammar ibn Abi Ammar
potential_issues.impact: While both narrators are acceptable, the use of indirect transmission in sequence can suggest some distance in the chain, though not a critical issue given the overall reliability of other narrators

hadiths.IISGrade: Sound

potential_issues.impact: Although Qatadah is generally reliable and widely accepted despite his tadlis, his use of 'an should be noted. However, given his overall reliability and the strength of the rest of the chain, this does not significantly weaken the hadith
